**Course objectives:**

This course aimsto build and strengthen students’ expository writing abilities and compositionskills through lecture discussions and writing practices. The course lessons aredesigned to guide students to write effective and well-formed essays throughthe process of: pre-writing, planning, drafting, editing and revising. Inaddition, students will learn to use adequate sentence structures and expressions,and to identify and avoid common grammatical errors. In the year-long course, studentswill be introduced to and practice writing different kinds of essays that fallwithin four major categories of: narration, description, exposition andargumentation. Besides formal lecture instructions, class discussions and actualwritings, students will also opportunities to provide peer critique for other members' works. Students,therefore, shall become more proficient in writing and editing simultaneously. By the completion of the course, itis expected that students are more proficient in forming well-organized, andwell-focused essays by applying adequate English expressions, relevant content and appropriate sentencestructures.

**Grading Basis:**

(1). Class participation and homework assignments, 15%

(2). Essays (drafts and revisions), 70%

(3) Peer critique, 15%
